snippet: Despite economic recovery, the share of corporate income going to workers has sunk to its lowest level since 1951.
abstract: News Analysis; Americans' wages have remained stubbornly flat since 2009, despite unemployment rate falling substantially since end of recession; reasons for stagnant wages are varied, although some economists see hope for higher wages in efforts to increase minimum wage as well as base wages at chain restaurants and large retailers.
lead_paragraph: Despite economic recovery, the share of corporate income going to workers has sunk to its lowest level since 1951.

headline.print_headline: The Mystery of the Vanishing Pay Raise
headline.main: The Mystery of the Vanishing Pay Raise
